info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:26PM MDT until July 29 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Montana, including the following counties, in south central Montana, east central Big Horn. In southeast Montana, southern Rosebud.
* WHEN...Until 1130 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry drainages.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Horse Creek, Black Canyon Creek, Lame Deer Creek, Pawnee Creek, Rosebud Creek, Muddy Creek, Middle Fork Bull Creek, South Fork Lame Deer Creek, Broken Jaw Creek, Black Eagle Fork, East Fork Muddy Creek, Stebbins Creek, Slocum Creek, Longroach Creek, Saint Johns Fork, Two Moon Creek, Logging Creek, South Fork Alderson Creek, Standing Elk Creek, Wild Hog Creek, Kelty Creek, Hardrobe Creek, Tie Creek, West Fork Muddy Creek, Paddy Creek, Spang Creek, Greenleaf Creek, Powell Creek, Cook Creek, Juddy Creek and Upper Spang Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muddy Cluster and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING
